intro: Cissampelos glaberrima, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when ripe, containing seeds enclosed in a fleshy pulp. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
